title: Love Island's Amber Gill rules out rekindling romance with Greg O'Shea
text:
She stole the nation's hearts with her girl's girl persona and romance with Greg O'Shea as she won this year's edition of Love Island, but was left heartbroken when he called things off after just 39 days together.

But Amber Gill has insisted she's well and truly over her ex-boyfriend Greg as she admitted she's 'too busy' to get back into the dating scene but wishes her 'DMs were poppin' following her series win.

In an exclusive interview with MailOnline, the former beautician, 22, lifted the lid on her thriving career, her close friendships with her fellow Islanders and what fans can expect from her next ahead of the launch of her new clothing collection with fashion retailer MissPap, available from Thursday.

She means business! Amber Gill has lifted the lid on life after Love Island as she launches her new clothing collection with fashion retailer MissPap, available from Thursday

Over the summer, the Geordie beauty was crowned the champion of the popular ITV2 series alongside her then-partner Greg, 24.

While the couple's budding romance seemed promising, the Newcastle native and the trainee solicitor became the fastest winners to part ways in the show's history as they split after just five weeks together.

Amber - who previously said she was blindsided by their break-up - has since insisted she has no plans on rekindling their relationship.

When asked about the Irish rugby player, the curly-haired bombshell defiantly said: 'Um… who? I don’t know who you’re talking about!

'Greg, who?' In an exclusive interview with MailOnline, the former beautician, 22, insisted she has no plans on rekindling her relationship with ex Greg O'Shea, 24 (pictured in August)

Unbothered! When asked about the Irish rugby player, the curly-haired bombshell defiantly said: 'Um… who? I don’t know who you’re talking about!'

'I wish my DMs were poppin': On whether she's looking forward to dating in the future, the TV personality admitted she's 'too busy' to be with someone at the moment

'No I’m joking, I don’t keep in contact with him. I don’t think [rekindling] the romance is on the cards.'

On whether she's looking forward to dating in the future, the TV personality admitted that while she'd love some attention from social media users, she's 'too busy' to be with someone at the moment.

She shared: 'People think my DMs are poppin’ off but there absolutely not! I wish they were! To be honest, I haven’t really got time to be dating anyone, I’m happy with all the work I’ve got going on.'

Since leaving the villa, Amber has served as a guest panellist on talk show Loose Women, modelled for retail company Littlewoods and most recently, signed a £1 million deal as the new face of MissPap.

Stronger than ever: During her stint, she grew close to stunning pharmacist Anna Vakili and Irish scientist Yewande Biala (pictured last month)

A friend indeed: The media personality also forged a sweet relationship with hunky basketball player Ovie Soko

'We love living together': Amber revealed she's been living with Anna, 29, in London, but is actively looking to move into her own apartment in the English capital

Shedding light on life after Love Island, the reality star enthused: 'Life has been turned upside down. It’s really different but it’s really fun and I’m loving it.

'People saw that I’m a girls’ girl, but I’m glad I’ve got the platform now to share how I feel with everybody.'

During her stint, she grew close to stunning pharmacist Anna Vakili, Irish scientist Yewande Biala and hunky basketball player Ovie Soko.

On her strong friendships, the TV star said: 'I keep in contact with majority of the girls, I was really close to Anna so I talk to her the most. I don’t really speak to many of the boys, other than Ovie. I was actually with them last night.'

Legs for days! The striking campaign sees the fierce bombshell model a selection of her sensational ensembles

The media personality - who was based in Newcastle - revealed she's been living with her BFF Anna in London for the past couple of months, but is actively looking to move into her own apartment in the English capital.

She said: 'I’m looking for an apartment in London at the moment, I’m living with Anna but we have so much stuff – there’s not enough space. We love living together but it just gets overcrowded – unless we wanted to get a six-bedroom house.'

In the midst of Love Island, viewers were left raging when Amber's first love interest Michael Griffiths ditched her for Joanna Chimonides during her time in Casa Amor.

After weeks of conflict, the outspoken star and firefighter Michael, 28, finally buried the hatchet, but Amber has confessed the pair have barely kept in contact since their time in the Mallorcan villa.

Explosive: In the midst of Love Island, viewers were left raging when Amber's first love interest Michael Griffiths ditched her for Joanna Chimonides while in Casa Amor (pictured on show)

'I only talk to my actual friends': After weeks of conflict, the outspoken star and firefighter Michael, 28, buried the hatchet, but Amber has confessed the pair have barely kept in contact

'He hasn’t contacted me and I haven’t contacted him', she said. 'I’m just super busy so I contact people that I’m actually friends with and close to. I mean, we haven’t really kept in touch.'

This year's Love Islanders have all kept busy since their stint - with grid girl Maura Higgins set to air on celebrity competition Dancing On Ice, while influencer Molly-Mae Hague recently released a clothing collection with PrettyLittleThing.

Amid constant comparisons between the co-stars, Amber has insisted there's 'no competition' as 'there's room for everyone to win'.

She explained: 'I don’t think that there’s any competition – I’ve gotten everything that I want from it, we’re all different so we can’t all go down the same path.

Power moves: This year's Love Islanders have all kept busy since their stint - with grid girl Maura Higgins set to air on celebrity competition Dancing On Ice

'I'm doing everything that I want to be doing': Amid constant comparisons between the co-stars, Amber has insisted there's 'no competition' as 'there's room for everyone to win'

'There’s room for everyone to win. With our different personalities, naturally we’re going to do different things. I’m doing everything that I want to be doing.'

Earlier this year, host Caroline Flack announced the first ever version of Winter Love Island will air on ITV2 in January 2020.

Insisting she certainly isn't worried about staying 'relevant' once the new series kicks off, Amber reasoned: 'I feel very fortunate to have built a platform of myself, and for people to have an image of me being just myself and my personality, not for being in a relationship.

'I can’t imagine there’s going to be anyone similar to me because I’m my own person. Everybody’s unique, I’m totally different to anyone else so I’m just not worrying about that. I’m me, so people will follow me if they want to.

'It's gonna be a long hot winter': Earlier this year, host Caroline Flack announced the first ever version of Winter Love Island will air on ITV2 in January 2020

'I'm my own person': The star claimed she certainly isn't worried about staying 'relevant' once the new series kicks off

'I can’t imagine it being like my season, it was heavily focused on the girls and I haven’t seen that before. It was all about girl power and the girls sticking together. Me and Anna are not going to fall off just because of another season.'

With the Love Island crown and a series of business ventures already under her belt, the successful star has now launched her latest collection with online fashion retailer MissPap.

On her new range, Amber enthused: 'I was really part of the design process so it’s really good to see it all come out tomorrow.

'I love the flowy mini dress that’s currently on the billboard, as well as a black ruched mini dress. I couldn’t possibly pick one.

'The collection channels my style, it’s for party girls. It’s very inclusive too, it’s from size 6-26 which was really important to me. Having something for everyone really means a lot to me.'

The striking campaign - which sees the fierce bombshell model a selection of her sensational ensembles - was shot in Miami, and Amber has gushed 'the vibe' of the sunny city 'matched the collection'.

On her stance with body confidence, she encouraged fans to 'be who you are' as 'everyone's unique'.

The pint-sized star elaborated: 'I don’t think I’ve ever had issues with body confidence, I always think that people are unique and you are what you are.

'I was really part of the whole process': With the Love Island crown and a series of business ventures already under her belt, the successful star has now launched her latest collection

'Everyone’s different, so there’s no point of comparing yourself to others. I’ve always been confident because I am what I am.

On her next steps, Amber teased: 'I’ll be releasing another collection with MissPap, and I’m going to make a YouTube channel which will show my personality, you can’t really see that on Instagram.

'People want to see me being daft. There’s other things coming up, I can’t say right now.

'I need to think about where I would film my YouTube and things like that, I need a room dedicated to making videos and a place to put all my clothes, so I’m currently looking. I’m really looking forward to it.'

Amber's MissPap collection will be available to shop online from 5pm on Thursday.
description: In an exclusive interview with MailOnline, the Love Island winner, 22, insisted she's well and truly over her ex-boyfriend Greg, 24, as she admitted she's 'too busy' to get back into the dating scene.
